abstract: A 2010 ruling that set the stage for unlimited donations to “super PACs” also enabled unions to send their foot soldiers to the homes of voters who don’t belong to unions.
snippet: A 2010 ruling that set the stage for unlimited donations to “super PACs” also enabled unions to send their foot soldiers to the homes of voters who don’t belong to unions.
lead_paragraph: As the A.F.L.-C.I.O. prepares to endorse President Obama on Tuesday, labor leaders say they will mount their biggest campaign effort, with far more union members than ever before — at least 400,000, they say — knocking on voters’ doors to counter the well-endowed “super PACs” backing Republicans.

headline.main: Labor Leaders Plan to Apply New Clout in Effort for Obama
headline.print_headline: Labor Leaders Plan Door-to-Door Effort for Obama

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Citizens United v Federal Election Commission (Supreme Court Decision)
